intro: Matelea hirta, commonly known as the hairy matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Matelea hirta is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
